intro: Endlicheria tomentella, commonly known as the woolly endlicheria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
